text: The 1982 season was the 100th season in Philadelphia Phillies franchise history. During the season, Steve Carlton would be the last pitcher to win at least 20 games in one season for the Phillies in the 20th century.Great Baseball Feats, Facts and Figures, 2008 Edition, p.98, David Nemec and Scott Flatow, A Signet Book, Penguin Group, New York, He would also become the first pitcher to win four Cy Young Awards in a career.Great Baseball Feats, Facts and Figures, 2008 Edition, p.234, David Nemec and Scott Flatow, A Signet Book, Penguin Group, New York, The 1982 Phillies finished the season with an 89-73 record, placing them in second place in the NL East, three games behind the World Series Champion St. Louis Cardinals. == Offseason == * December 6, 1981: Bob Boone was purchased from the Phillies by the California Angels.Bob Boone at Baseball Reference * December 8, 1981: Dickie Noles, Dan Larson and Keith Moreland were traded by the Phillies to the Chicago Cubs for Mike Krukow and cash.Dickie Noles at Baseball Reference * January 27, 1982: Larry Bowa and Ryne Sandberg were traded by the Phillies to the Chicago Cubs for Iván DeJesús.Ryne Sandberg at Baseball Reference * February 16, 1982: Bake McBride was traded by the Phillies to the Cleveland Indians for Sid Monge.Bake McBride at Baseball Reference == Regular season == * July 19, 1982: Tony Gwynn made his major league debut for the San Diego Padres against the Phillies.Tony Gwynn at Baseball Reference In a 7-6 Phillies road victory, Gwynn had four at- bats. Gwynn gets two hits, one run, and one RBI.http://www.baseball- almanac.com/box-scores/boxscore.php?boxid=198207190SDN === Season standings === ===Record vs. opponents=== === Notable transactions === * April 13, 1982: Tim Corcoran was signed as a free agent by the Phillies.Tim Corcoran at Baseball Reference * May 14, 1982: Rowland Office was signed as a free agent by the Phillies.Rowland Office at Baseball Reference * June 7, 1982: Bruce Ruffin was drafted by the Phillies in the 31st round of the 1982 Major League Baseball draft, but did not sign.Bruce Ruffin at Baseball Reference * June 8, 1982: Del Unser was released by the Phillies.Del Unser at Baseball Reference * June 15, 1982: Dick Davis was traded by the Phillies to the Toronto Blue Jays for Wayne Nordhagen.Dick Davis at Baseball Reference * June 15, 1982: Wayne Nordhagen was traded by the Phillies to the Pittsburgh Pirates for Bill Robinson.Wayne Nordhagen at Baseball Reference * August 10, 1982: Willie Montañez was signed as a free agent by the Phillies.Willie Montañez at Baseball Reference * August 21, 1982: Sparky Lyle was purchased from the Phillies by the Chicago White Sox.Sparky Lyle at Baseball Reference * September 12, 1982: Jerry Reed, Wil Culmer, and Roy Smith were traded by the Phillies to the Cleveland Indians for John Denny.Roy Smith at Baseball Reference ===1982 Game Log=== {| class="wikitable"
